docs.lead_paragraph: The Fair Labor Association, the firm that Apple has hired to examine worker conditions at the plants of its suppliers, has been criticized by labor groups as ineffective.

headline.seo: Critics Question Record of Fair Labor Association, Apple’s Monitor
headline.main: Critics Question Record of Monitor Selected by Apple
headline.print_headline: Critics Question Record of Monitor Selected by Apple

docs.abstract: Fair Labor Association, hired by Apple to examine worker conditions at the plants of its suppliers, has been criticized by labor groups as ineffective; association was founded in 1999, by universities and non-profit groups, along with Nike, Liz Claiborne and several other American apparel companies in an effort to eliminate workplace abuses, but labor advocates say the group has done little to improve conditions worldwide.
docs.snippet: The Fair Labor Association, the firm that Apple has hired to examine worker conditions at the plants of its suppliers, has been criticized by labor groups as ineffective.

docs.lead_paragraph: The head of the New York City Commission on Human Rights responds to an Op-Ed article about pregnant employees.
docs.snippet: The head of the New York City Commission on Human Rights responds to an Op-Ed article about pregnant employees.

docs.lead_paragraph: Several states have moved to ban or restrict the use of so-called gestational crates, the tiny stalls in which sows are housed while pregnant.

headline.seo: McDonald’s Vows to Help End Use of Sow Crates
headline.main: McDonald’s Set to Phase Out Suppliers’ Use of Sow Crates
headline.print_headline: McDonald’s Set to Phase Out Suppliers’ Use of Sow Crates

docs.abstract: McDonald's Corporation announces that it will begin working with its pork suppliers to phase out the use of so-called gestational crates, tiny stalls in which sows are housed while pregnant; animal rights advocates have long said that the crates, known as sow stalls and little more than 2 feet by 7 feet, are inhumane, and several states have moved to ban or restrict them; several large suppliers, including Smithfield Farms and Cargill, have already reduced their use of the crates.
docs.snippet: Several states have moved to ban or restrict the use of so-called gestational crates, the tiny stalls in which sows are housed while pregnant.

headline.main: Raising the Price of Reproductive Rights

docs.abstract: State and local restrictions on abortion have made it harder for women, especially among the poor, to obtain abortions, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: State and local restrictions on abortion have made it harder for women, especially among the poor, to obtain abortions, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nancy Folbre is an economics professor at the University of Massachusetts, Amherst.

headline.main: Raising the Price of Reproductive Rights

docs.abstract: State and local restrictions on abortion have made it harder for women, especially among the poor, to obtain abortions, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: After supporting abortion rights early in his political career, Mitt Romney is working to reinforce his credentials among conservatives.

headline.seo: Romney’s Path to ‘Pro-Life’ Position on Abortion
headline.main: Romney’s Path to ‘Pro-Life’ Position on Abortion

docs.abstract: Mitt Romney has plunged headlong into abortion politics as the nation's culture wars are erupting anew over a federal rule requiring religiously affiliated hospitals to provide birth control as part of their insurance plans; examination of Romney's stance on abortion shows his evolution from abortion rights advocate to abortion foe.
docs.snippet: After supporting abortion rights early in his political career, Mitt Romney is working to reinforce his credentials among conservatives.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Conference of Catholic Bishops said a compromise offered by President Obama on birth control coverage did not go far enough in protecting religious liberty.

headline.main: Bishops Reject White House’s New Plan on Contraception
headline.print_headline: Catholic Bishops Reject New Plan on Contraception

docs.abstract: United States Conference of Catholic Bishops rejects Pres Obama's compromise on birth control coverage, saying it does not go far enough in protecting religious liberty; group faces a potential rift with some allies who welcomed the compromise, which puts the onus of providing free contraceptives on health insurance companies rather than the Catholic institutions themselves.
docs.snippet: The United States Conference of Catholic Bishops said a compromise offered by President Obama on birth control coverage did not go far enough in protecting religious liberty.

keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama’s accommodation to church groups was not needed, but it preserves the basic principle of free access to birth control for any woman.

headline.seo: The Freedom to Choose Birth Control
headline.main: The Freedom to Choose Birth Control
headline.print_headline: The Freedom to Choose Birth Control

docs.abstract: Editorial argues that Pres Obama did not need to accommodate religious institutions by allowing them to shift the cost of contraceptives to their insurance companies, but at least his rule preserves the basic principle of free access to birth control for any woman.
docs.snippet: President Obama’s accommodation to church groups was not needed, but it preserves the basic principle of free access to birth control for any woman.

docs.lead_paragraph: Although Archbishop Timothy M. Dolan has been leading the fight against requirements for insurance coverage of birth control, Catholic health institutions, including those in his own diocese, have for 10 years complied with law.

headline.seo: Catholic Institutions Reluctantly Comply With N.Y. Contraceptives Law
headline.main: N.Y. Law on Contraceptives Already in Place, and Catholic Institutions Comply
headline.print_headline: Catholic Institutions Reluctantly Obey New York Law on Contraceptives Coverage

docs.abstract: Some New York Roman Catholic organizations have been grudgingly complying with a state law for 10 years that mandates that religiously affiliated institutions cover birth control in their insurance plans; Archbishop Timothy M Dolan of New York has been leading the fight against a similar national requirement.
docs.snippet: Although Archbishop Timothy M. Dolan has been leading the fight against requirements for insurance coverage of birth control, Catholic health institutions, including those in his own diocese, have for 10 years complied with law.
